result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: No contact with DC or his residence of 16640 South Flowage Road Wascott, WI 54838.  May return with law enforcement to gather belongings.

3:16 PM Defendant Matthew Centorcelli in court. Attorney Jacob Gondik appears with defendant.  Attorney Chad LaLor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney Gondik indicates this is a special appearance, it is defendant's intent to hire Gondik Law. Acknowledges receipt, waives reading, pleads not guilty. Court accepts pleas. Address updated. 
State indicates already posted 150 cash, request $150 cash, no contact with DC or his residence of 16640 South Flowage Road Wascott, WI 54838
Attorney objects to no contact of address, defendant's place of employment. Asks for only no contact with D.C. 
State responds that based on allegations, are standing by request of no contact with address. 
Court orders $150 cash already posted, with conditions of no contact with DC or his residence of 16640 South Flowage Road Wascott, WI 54838
Attorney Gondik asks for law enforcement contact to gather belongings. Court so orders.
Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
